House File 2150 - Introduced


                                 HOUSE FILE 

                                 HOUSE FILE 
                                 HOUSE FILE                                  HOUSE FILE                                  BY  RUFF

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act relating to economic development by creating rural
  2    opportunity zones, a student loan repayment program and
  3    fund, an individual income tax credit, and including
  4    applicability provisions.
  5 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 5605YH (2) 86
    mm/sc

PAG LIN



  1  1    Section 1.

  1  1    Section 1.  

  1  1    Section 1.  
  1  1    Section 1.    1  1    Section 1.    1  2    1.  The authority shall designate a county of this state as
  1  3 a rural opportunity zone if it meets the eligibility criteria
  1  4 in section 15E.186.  A county shall remain designated as a
  1  5 rural opportunity zone until it loses its designation from
  1  6 the authority.  A county may lose its designation as a rural
  1  7 opportunity zone if events subsequent to its designation cause
  1  8 it to no longer meet the criteria specified in section 15E.186.
  1  9 However, a county shall not lose its designation as a rural
  1 10 opportunity zone during its participation in the student loan
  1 11 repayment program under section 15E.188.
  1 12    2.  A county may apply to the authority for designation as a
  1 13 rural opportunity zone.  The application shall be made by the
  1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1  3 a rural opportunity zone if it meets the eligibility criteria
  1  4 in section 15E.186.  A county shall remain designated as a
  1  5 rural opportunity zone until it loses its designation from
  1  6 the authority.  A county may lose its designation as a rural
  1  7 opportunity zone if events subsequent to its designation cause
  1  8 it to no longer meet the criteria specified in section 15E.186.
  1  9 However, a county shall not lose its designation as a rural
  1 10 opportunity zone during its participation in the student loan
  1 11 repayment program under section 15E.188.
  1 12    2.  A county may apply to the authority for designation as a
  1 13 rural opportunity zone.  The application shall be made by the
  1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1  4 in section 15E.186.  A county shall remain designated as a

  1 11 repayment program under section 15E.188.

  1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for

  1 17 does not submit an application.

  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.

  1 13 rural opportunity zone.  The application shall be made by the
  1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.

  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.

  1 13 rural opportunity zone.  The application shall be made by the
  1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.

  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 13 rural opportunity zone.  The application shall be made by the
  1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 14 county board of supervisors in the form and manner prescribed
  1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 15 by the authority. The authority shall consider each county for
  1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 16 designation as a rural opportunity zone, even if the county
  1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 17 does not submit an application.
  1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 18    3.  The authority shall review the eligibility of each county
  1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 19 in this state as a rural opportunity zone at least annually.
  1 20    Sec. 2.    1 20    Sec. 2.    1 21 eligibility criteria.
  1 22    A county may be designated by the authority as a rural
  1 23 opportunity zone if it meets at least two of the following
  1 24 criteria:
  1 25    1.  The county has an average weekly wage that ranks among
  1 26 the bottom twenty=five counties in the state based on the 2010
  1 27 annual average weekly wage for employees in private business.
  1 28    2.  The county has a per capita income of twelve thousand six
  1 29 hundred forty=eight dollars or less based on the 2010 certified
  1 30 federal census.
  1 31    3.  The county has a family poverty rate of twelve percent or
  1 32 higher based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  1 33    4.  The county has a family poverty rate that ranks among
  1 34 the top twenty=five counties in the state based on the 2010
  1 35 certified federal census.
  2  1    5.  The county has experienced a percentage population
  2  2 loss that ranks among the top twenty=five counties in the
  2  3 state between 2005 and 2010.  For purposes of this subsection,
  2  4 prison population shall be excluded in the population loss
  2  5 calculations.
  2  6    6.  The county has a percentage of persons sixty=five years
  2  7 of age or older that ranks among the top twenty=five counties
  2  8 in the state based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  2  9    7.  Ten percent or more of the housing units in the county
  2 10 are vacant.
  2 11    8.  The average valuation for each class of property in the
  2 12 county is seventy=five percent or less of the statewide average
  2 13 for that classification based upon the most recent valuations
  2 14 for property tax purposes.
  2 15    9.  A recent business closure or permanent layoff has
  2 16 occurred in the county.  The business closure or permanent
  2 17 layoff must involve the loss of full=time employees, not
  2 18 including retail employees, at one place of business totaling
  2 19 at least one thousand employees or four percent or more of
  2 20 the county's resident labor force based on the most recent
  2 21 annual resident labor force statistics from the department of
  2 22 workforce development, whichever is lower.  A permanent layoff
  2 23 does not include a layoff of seasonal employees or a layoff
  2 24 that is seasonal in nature. For purposes of this paragraph,
  2 25 "permanent layoff" means the loss of jobs to an out=of=state
  2 26 location, the cessation of one or more production lines, the
  2 27 removal of manufacturing machinery and equipment, or similar
  2 28 actions determined to be equivalent in nature by the authority.
  2 29 For purposes of this subsection, a permanent layoff must occur
  2 30 on or after the effective date of this Act.
  2 31    Sec. 3.    1 22    A county may be designated by the authority as a rural
  1 23 opportunity zone if it meets at least two of the following
  1 24 criteria:
  1 25    1.  The county has an average weekly wage that ranks among
  1 26 the bottom twenty=five counties in the state based on the 2010
  1 27 annual average weekly wage for employees in private business.
  1 28    2.  The county has a per capita income of twelve thousand six
  1 29 hundred forty=eight dollars or less based on the 2010 certified
  1 30 federal census.
  1 31    3.  The county has a family poverty rate of twelve percent or
  1 32 higher based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  1 33    4.  The county has a family poverty rate that ranks among
  1 34 the top twenty=five counties in the state based on the 2010
  1 35 certified federal census.
  2  1    5.  The county has experienced a percentage population
  2  2 loss that ranks among the top twenty=five counties in the
  2  3 state between 2005 and 2010.  For purposes of this subsection,
  2  4 prison population shall be excluded in the population loss
  2  5 calculations.
  2  6    6.  The county has a percentage of persons sixty=five years
  2  7 of age or older that ranks among the top twenty=five counties
  2  8 in the state based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  2  9    7.  Ten percent or more of the housing units in the county
  2 10 are vacant.
  2 11    8.  The average valuation for each class of property in the
  2 12 county is seventy=five percent or less of the statewide average
  2 13 for that classification based upon the most recent valuations
  2 14 for property tax purposes.
  2 15    9.  A recent business closure or permanent layoff has
  2 16 occurred in the county.  The business closure or permanent
  2 17 layoff must involve the loss of full=time employees, not
  2 18 including retail employees, at one place of business totaling
  2 19 at least one thousand employees or four percent or more of
  2 20 the county's resident labor force based on the most recent
  2 21 annual resident labor force statistics from the department of
  2 22 workforce development, whichever is lower.  A permanent layoff
  2 23 does not include a layoff of seasonal employees or a layoff
  2 24 that is seasonal in nature. For purposes of this paragraph,
  2 25 "permanent layoff" means the loss of jobs to an out=of=state
  2 26 location, the cessation of one or more production lines, the
  2 27 removal of manufacturing machinery and equipment, or similar
  2 28 actions determined to be equivalent in nature by the authority.
  2 29 For purposes of this subsection, a permanent layoff must occur
  2 30 on or after the effective date of this Act.

  1 29 hundred forty=eight dollars or less based on the 2010 certified
  1 30 federal census.
  1 31    3.  The county has a family poverty rate of twelve percent or
  1 32 higher based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  1 33    4.  The county has a family poverty rate that ranks among
  1 34 the top twenty=five counties in the state based on the 2010
  1 35 certified federal census.
  2  1    5.  The county has experienced a percentage population
  2  2 loss that ranks among the top twenty=five counties in the
  2  3 state between 2005 and 2010.  For purposes of this subsection,
  2  4 prison population shall be excluded in the population loss
  2  5 calculations.
  2  6    6.  The county has a percentage of persons sixty=five years
  2  7 of age or older that ranks among the top twenty=five counties
  2  8 in the state based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  2  9    7.  Ten percent or more of the housing units in the county
  2 10 are vacant.
  2 11    8.  The average valuation for each class of property in the
  2 12 county is seventy=five percent or less of the statewide average
  2 13 for that classification based upon the most recent valuations
  2 14 for property tax purposes.
  2 15    9.  A recent business closure or permanent layoff has
  2 16 occurred in the county.  The business closure or permanent
  2 17 layoff must involve the loss of full=time employees, not
  2 18 including retail employees, at one place of business totaling
  2 19 at least one thousand employees or four percent or more of
  2 20 the county's resident labor force based on the most recent
  2 21 annual resident labor force statistics from the department of
  2 22 workforce development, whichever is lower.  A permanent layoff
  2 23 does not include a layoff of seasonal employees or a layoff
  2 24 that is seasonal in nature. For purposes of this paragraph,
  2 25 "permanent layoff" means the loss of jobs to an out=of=state
  2 26 location, the cessation of one or more production lines, the
  2 27 removal of manufacturing machinery and equipment, or similar
  2 28 actions determined to be equivalent in nature by the authority.
  2 29 For purposes of this subsection, a permanent layoff must occur
  2 30 on or after the effective date of this Act.
  2 31    Sec. 3.    1 28    2.  The county has a per capita income of twelve thousand six
  1 29 hundred forty=eight dollars or less based on the 2010 certified
  1 30 federal census.

  1 32 higher based on the 2010 certified federal census.

  2 24 that is seasonal in nature. For purposes of this paragraph,
  2 25 "permanent layoff" means the loss of jobs to an out=of=state
  2 26 location, the cessation of one or more production lines, the
  2 27 removal of manufacturing machinery and equipment, or similar
  2 28 actions determined to be equivalent in nature by the authority.
  2 29 For purposes of this subsection, a permanent layoff must occur
  2 30 on or after the effective date of this Act.
  2 31    Sec. 3.    2  8 in the state based on the 2010 certified federal census.
  2  9    7.  Ten percent or more of the housing units in the county
  2 10 are vacant.
  2 11    8.  The average valuation for each class of property in the
  2 12 county is seventy=five percent or less of the statewide average
  2 13 for that classification based upon the most recent valuations
  2 14 for property tax purposes.
  2 15    9.  A recent business closure or permanent layoff has
  2 16 occurred in the county.  The business closure or permanent
  2 17 layoff must involve the loss of full=time employees, not
  2 18 including retail employees, at one place of business totaling
  2 19 at least one thousand employees or four percent or more of
  2 20 the county's resident labor force based on the most recent
  2 21 annual resident labor force statistics from the department of
  2 22 workforce development, whichever is lower.  A permanent layoff
  2 23 does not include a layoff of seasonal employees or a layoff
  2 24 that is seasonal in nature. For purposes of this paragraph,
  2 25 "permanent layoff" means the loss of jobs to an out=of=state
  2 26 location, the cessation of one or more production lines, the
  2 27 removal of manufacturing machinery and equipment, or similar
  2 28 actions determined to be equivalent in nature by the authority.
  2 29 For purposes of this subsection, a permanent layoff must occur
  2 30 on or after the effective date of this Act.

  2 31    Sec. 3.    2 30 on or after the effective date of this Act.
  2 31    Sec. 3.    2 31    Sec. 3.    2 32 fund.
  2 33    A student loan repayment program fund is created in the
  2 34 state treasury under the control of the authority.  The fund
  2 35 shall consist of all moneys appropriated to it by the general
  3  1 assembly.  The moneys in the fund are not subject to the
  3  2 provisions of section 8.33 and shall not be transferred, used,
  3  3 obligated, appropriated, or otherwise encumbered except as
  3  4 provided in section 15E.188.  Notwithstanding section 12C.7,
  3  5 subsection 2, earnings or interest on moneys appropriated
  3  6 pursuant to this section shall be retained by the fund and used
  3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.
  3  8    Sec. 4.    2 33    A student loan repayment program fund is created in the
  2 34 state treasury under the control of the authority.  The fund
  2 35 shall consist of all moneys appropriated to it by the general
  3  1 assembly.  The moneys in the fund are not subject to the
  3  2 provisions of section 8.33 and shall not be transferred, used,
  3  3 obligated, appropriated, or otherwise encumbered except as
  3  4 provided in section 15E.188.  Notwithstanding section 12C.7,
  3  5 subsection 2, earnings or interest on moneys appropriated
  3  6 pursuant to this section shall be retained by the fund and used
  3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.
  3  8    Sec. 4.    2 34 state treasury under the control of the authority.  The fund
  2 35 shall consist of all moneys appropriated to it by the general
  3  1 assembly.  The moneys in the fund are not subject to the
  3  2 provisions of section 8.33 and shall not be transferred, used,
  3  3 obligated, appropriated, or otherwise encumbered except as
  3  4 provided in section 15E.188.  Notwithstanding section 12C.7,
  3  5 subsection 2, earnings or interest on moneys appropriated
  3  6 pursuant to this section shall be retained by the fund and used
  3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.
  3  8    Sec. 4.    2 35 shall consist of all moneys appropriated to it by the general

  3  2 provisions of section 8.33 and shall not be transferred, used,

  3  5 subsection 2, earnings or interest on moneys appropriated
  3  6 pursuant to this section shall be retained by the fund and used
  3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.

  3  6 pursuant to this section shall be retained by the fund and used
  3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.

  3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.
  3  8    Sec. 4.    3  7 for the purposes designated until expended.
  3  8    Sec. 4.    3  8    Sec. 4.    3  9 program.
  3 10    1.  For purposes of this section, unless the context
  3 11 otherwise requires:
  3 12    a.  "Institution of higher education" means the same as
  3 13 defined in section 12D.1.
  3 14    b.  "Outstanding student loan debt" means the student loan
  3 15 debt balance of a participating individual at the time of
  3 16 enrollment in the program, which debt was incurred by the
  3 17 participating individual for attendance at an institution of
  3 18 higher education where such participating individual earned
  3 19 credits toward an associate, bachelor, or postgraduate degree.
  3 20    c.  "Participating county" means a county which has adopted a
  3 21 resolution creating a county component in the program pursuant
  3 22 to subsection 4.
  3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.
  3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    3 10    1.  For purposes of this section, unless the context
  3 11 otherwise requires:
  3 12    a.  "Institution of higher education" means the same as
  3 13 defined in section 12D.1.
  3 14    b.  "Outstanding student loan debt" means the student loan
  3 15 debt balance of a participating individual at the time of
  3 16 enrollment in the program, which debt was incurred by the
  3 17 participating individual for attendance at an institution of
  3 18 higher education where such participating individual earned
  3 19 credits toward an associate, bachelor, or postgraduate degree.
  3 20    c.  "Participating county" means a county which has adopted a
  3 21 resolution creating a county component in the program pursuant
  3 22 to subsection 4.
  3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.
  3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    3 11 otherwise requires:
  3 12    a.  "Institution of higher education" means the same as
  3 13 defined in section 12D.1.
  3 14    b.  "Outstanding student loan debt" means the student loan
  3 15 debt balance of a participating individual at the time of
  3 16 enrollment in the program, which debt was incurred by the
  3 17 participating individual for attendance at an institution of
  3 18 higher education where such participating individual earned
  3 19 credits toward an associate, bachelor, or postgraduate degree.
  3 20    c.  "Participating county" means a county which has adopted a
  3 21 resolution creating a county component in the program pursuant
  3 22 to subsection 4.
  3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.
  3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.

  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    3 16 enrollment in the program, which debt was incurred by the
  3 17 participating individual for attendance at an institution of
  3 18 higher education where such participating individual earned
  3 19 credits toward an associate, bachelor, or postgraduate degree.
  3 20    c.  "Participating county" means a county which has adopted a
  3 21 resolution creating a county component in the program pursuant
  3 22 to subsection 4.
  3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.
  3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    3 17 participating individual for attendance at an institution of
  3 18 higher education where such participating individual earned
  3 19 credits toward an associate, bachelor, or postgraduate degree.
  3 20    c.  "Participating county" means a county which has adopted a
  3 21 resolution creating a county component in the program pursuant
  3 22 to subsection 4.
  3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.
  3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:

  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.

  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.

  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.

  3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.
  3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    3 23    d.  "Participating individual" means an individual who meets
  3 24 the eligibility requirements in subsection 3, paragraph "a",
  3 25 for participation in the program, and who has enrolled in the
  3 26 program.
  3 27    e.  "Program" means the student loan repayment program
  3 28 established pursuant to this section.

  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    3 29    2.  There is established a student loan repayment program
  3 30 within the authority.  The program shall consist of a county
  3 31 component for each participating county and a matching
  3 32 component of the authority for the purpose of providing student
  3 33 loan repayment assistance on the outstanding student loan debt
  3 34 of participating individuals.
  3 35    3.  A county designated as a rural opportunity zone pursuant
  4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.

  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    4  1 to sections 15E.185 and 15E.186 may participate in the program
  4  2 if it creates and implements a county component.  A county
  4  3 component shall contain uniform terms and conditions prescribed
  4  4 by the authority, and shall meet the following minimum
  4  5 qualifications:
  4  6    a.  The county component shall apply only to resident
  4  7 individuals who have earned an associate, bachelor, or
  4  8 postgraduate degree from an institution of higher education,
  4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.

  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    4  9 who have outstanding student loan debt, and who establish
  4 10 domicile in the applicable county on or after the county adopts
  4 11 a resolution creating a county component pursuant to subsection
  4 12 4, and prior to July 1, 2021.
  4 13    b.  The county component shall provide that participating
  4 14 individuals are entitled to full participation in the county
  4 15 component for five years, provided the participating individual
  4 16 remains domiciled within that county for the entire five=year
  4 17 period.  A participating individual who establishes domicile
  4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.

  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    4 18 outside of the county for which the individual first qualified
  4 19 is ineligible to continue participation in the program.
  4 20    c.  The county, through its county component, shall agree to
  4 21 repay, subject to the availability of matching payments by the
  4 22 authority in subsection 6, over a five=year period, the lesser
  4 23 of ten percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  4 24 participating individual or seven thousand five hundred dollars
  4 25 of the outstanding student loan debt of the participating
  4 26 individual.  A participating individual must remain domiciled
  4 27 in the applicable county for an entire calendar year to receive
  4 28 repayment assistance for that year.
  4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.

  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
  5 34    7.  The authority shall adopt rules under chapter 17A
  5 35 relating to the administration of this section.
  6  1    Sec. 5.    4 29    4.  A county that creates and implements a county component
  4 30 must provide to the authority a duly adopted resolution from
  4 31 its board of supervisors on or before January 1, 2017.  The
  4 32 resolution shall be irrevocable and shall obligate the county
  4 33 to participate in the program for a period of five years for
  4 34 each participating individual.
  4 35    5.  A participating individual shall enroll in both the
  5  1 county component and the matching component of this program in
  5  2 the form and manner prescribed by the authority.
  5  3    6.  a.  The authority shall, subject to the availability
  5  4 of moneys in the student loan repayment program fund, match
  5  5 repayments made by a participating county under its county
  5  6 component for each participating individual up to the maximum
  5  7 repayment assistance amount specified in subsection 3,
  5  8 paragraph "c", for that individual.
  5  9    b.  Annual repayments of outstanding student loan debt by a
  5 10 participating county under its county component of the program,
  5 11 and matching repayments by the authority under the matching
  5 12 component of the program shall be made following the close of
  5 13 a calendar year and following the participating individual's
  5 14 certification by the authority and the applicable county
  5 15 that the participating individual is entitled to repayment
  5 16 assistance pursuant to the program.  Repayments will be made
  5 17 directly to the lender of the participating individual's
  5 18 outstanding student loan debt.
  5 19    c.  The maximum aggregate amount that any participating
  5 20 individual may receive from the county component and matching
  5 21 component of this program shall not exceed the lesser of
  5 22 twenty percent of the outstanding student loan debt of the
  5 23 participating individual or fifteen thousand dollars of the
  5 24 outstanding student loan debt of the participating individual.
  5 25    d.  Repayment assistance from the authority under the
  5 26 matching component of this program is subject to the
  5 27 availability of moneys in the student loan repayment program
  5 28 fund.  Nothing in this section guarantees a participating
  5 29 individual a right to receive benefits provided in this
  5 30 section.  A county may provide repayment assistance under
  5 31 its county component even if insufficient funds exist for
  5 32 the authority to provide matching funds under the matching
  5 33 component.
